title: Tension in the rope that is holding a plank

content.question: A <math alttext="12 kilogram " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> plank, which is <math alttext="4.0 meters " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> long, is attached to a wall by a hinge on its lower end. A rope, attached to the plank a distance of <math alttext="1.0 meter " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from its free end, is perpendicular to the plank and holds the plank at an angle of <math alttext="37 degrees " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>with the wall, as shown in the diagram above. skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
